title: Schema for a compiled, versioned Open Contracting Release.

Amendment.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

property.description: The property name that has been changed relative to the place the amendment is. For example if the contract value has changed, then the property under changes within the contract.amendment would be value.amount.

former_value.description: The previous value of the changed property, in whatever type the property is.

Amendment.title: Amendment information

Transaction.__comment: Does not have merge strategy fields as is always item in array, and array is versioned.

receiverOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.

uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about this spending transaction.
uri.title: Linked spending information

providerOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.

dataSource.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, IATI file, or machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.
dataSource.title: Data Source

id.description: An identifier for this transaction. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source. For the budget data package this is the id, for IATI, the transaction reference.

Transaction.description: A spending transaction related to the contracting process. Draws upon the data models of the [Budget Data Package](https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md) and the [International Aid Transpareny Initiative](http://iatistandard.org/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/transaction/) and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, IATI file, or to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with some other published source of transactional spending data.
Transaction.title: Transaction Information

milestones.description: As milestones are completed, milestone completions should be documented.

documents.description: Documents and reports that are part of the implementation phase e.g. audit and evaluation reports.

value.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract

Implementation.description: Information during the performance / implementation stage of the contract.
Implementation.title: Implementation

Address.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

Value.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

Budget.description: This section contain information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon data model of the [Budget Data Package](https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.
Budget.title: Budget Information

projectID.description: An external identifier for the project that this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the identifier from the relevant registry of projects.
projectID.title: Project Identifier

uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about the related budget for this project.
uri.title: Linked budget information

project.description: The name of the project that through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.
project.title: Project Title

amount.description: The value of the budget line item.

dataSource.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, or to a machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.
dataSource.title: Data Source

budgetSource.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.
budgetSource.title: Budget Source

id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.

Contract.description: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).
Contract.title: Contract

value.description: [Consult codelist] The current status of the contract e.g. active, cancelled.
value.title: Contract Status

documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the contract, including any notices.

value.description: Contract description
Contract title

implementation.description: Information during the performance / implementation stage of the contract.

milestones.description: As milestones are completed, milestone completions should be documented.

documents.description: Documents and reports that are part of the implementation phase e.g. audit and evaluation reports.

value.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract

implementation.title: Implementation

value.description: (Optional) The goods, services, and any intangible outcomes in this contract. If the items are the same as the award do not repeat.
value.title: Items Contracted

value.description: The start and end date for the contract.
The total value of this contract.
The date the contract was signed. In the case of multiple signatures, the date of the last signature.
The award.id against which this contract is being issued.
value.title: Award ID

id.description: The identifier for this contract. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid), it need not be unique in the package. e.g. ocid ABC can have contractID 1 & contractID 2 and ocid DEF can also have contractID 1 & 2. But if it is a different contract, ocid cannot have contractID 1 and 1 otherwise that will cause the data to be overridden when the record is compiled.
id.title: Contract ID

Period.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

startDate.description: The state date for the period.

endDate.description: The end date for the period.

Period.title: Period

Item.__comment: Does not have merge strategy fields as is always item in array, and array is versioned.
Item.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.

description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.

classification.description: [Consult codelist] The primary classification for the item. See the codelists to know which are preferred schemas.

additionalClassifications.description: [Consult codelist] The primary classification for the item. See the codelists to know which are preferred schemas.

id.description: A local identifier to reference the items by

unit.description: Description of the unit which the good comes in e.g. hours, kilograms

value.description: The value of a single unity

documents.description: A list of documents related to the planning process, including public hearing notices.

value.description: This section contain information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon data model of the [Budget Data Package](https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.
value.title: Budget Information

projectID.description: An external identifier for the project that this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the identifier from the relevant registry of projects.
projectID.title: Project Identifier

uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about the related budget for this project.
uri.title: Linked budget information

project.description: The name of the project that through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.
project.title: Project Title

amount.description: The value of the budget line item.

dataSource.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, or to a machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.
dataSource.title: Data Source

budgetSource.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.
budgetSource.title: Budget Source

id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.

value.description: The rationale for the procurement

Planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. Note that many other fields may be filled in a planning release, in the appropriate fields in other schema sections, these would likely be estimates at this stage e.g. totalValue in tender
Planning.title: Planning

Award.description: An award for the given procurement. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.
Award.title: Award

value.description: [Consult codelist] The current status of the award e.g. active, cancelled.
value.title: Award Status

documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the award, including any notices.

value.description: Award description
Award title
The goods and services awarded in this award, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.
value.title: Items Awarded

value.description: The suppliers awarded this award.
The total value of this award. There may be more than one award per procurement.

value.title: Award date
value.description: The date of the contract award.

id.description: The identifier for this award. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid), it need not be unique in the package. e.g. ocid ABC can have awardID 1 & awardID 2 and ocid DEF can also have awardID 1 & 2. But if it is a different award, ocid cannot have awardID 1 and 1 otherwise that will cause the data to be overridden when the record is compiled.
id.title: Award ID

Identifier.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

scheme.description: [Consult codelist] The scheme that holds the unique identifiers used to identify the item being identified. Consult the codelists first to check the standard schemes recommended for this identifier.

id.description: The identifier for the Thing under the given scheme.

uri.description: URI to identify the Thing under the given scheme.

description.description: The text-based description of the id, if provided by the scheme. In the case of a goods classification, this maybe the description of the code. In the case of an organzational identifier, this may be the legal name as recorded by the used registry.

date.description: The date the new status was realized.

status.description: [Consult codelist] The status that was realized on the date provided.

notes.description: Any notes or description of the new status.

value.description: A list that documents the progress of the milestone. As progress on the milestone continues, new items are added to the list to document the milestone's progress.
A description of the milestone.

documents.description: List of documents associated with this milestone.

value.description: A local, unique identifier for this milestone. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a milestone through the compilation from release to record mechanism.
Milestone title

Tender.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.
Tender.title: Tender

value.description: Specify tendering method as per GPA definitions of Open, Selective, Limited (http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm)
The date or period on which an award is anticipated to be made.
The period during which enquiries may be made and answered.
The minimum estimated value of the procurement.
Specify the selection criteria, by lowest cost,
The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.
Any detailed or further information on the selection criteria.
An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.
value.title: Tender ID

value.description: The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.

documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices.

value.description: Justification of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.
Tender title

Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.
[Consult codelist] The current status of the tender e.g. active, cancelled.
value.title: Tender Status

value.description: Description of eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.
Tender description
Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction

milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the tender.

value.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.
value.title: Items to be procured

value.description: The total estimated value of the procurement.
A Yes/No field as to whether enquiries were part of tender process.

Organization.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.
Organization.title: Organization

additionalIdentifiers.description: [Consult codelist] A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization. Consult the codelist for the preferred schemas to use.

contactPoint.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

identifier.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

scheme.description: [Consult codelist] The scheme that holds the unique identifiers used to identify the item being identified. Consult the codelists first to check the standard schemes recommended for this identifier.

id.description: The identifier for the Thing under the given scheme.

uri.description: URI to identify the Thing under the given scheme.

description.description: The text-based description of the id, if provided by the scheme. In the case of a goods classification, this maybe the description of the code. In the case of an organzational identifier, this may be the legal name as recorded by the used registry.

name.description: The used name of the organization. The ID property does provide an additional space for formal legal name, if common name is desired here.

address.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

ContactPoint.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

Document.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.
Document.title: Document

value.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.

[Consult codelist] A classification of the document described. Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.
The document title.
direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.

The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.
Date that the document was last modified
The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.

Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.
A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

contracts.description: Information from the contract creation phase of the procurement process.
contracts.title: Contracts

value.description: Specifies the default language of the data, in ISO 639-1 codes see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes.
value.title: Release language

buyer.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.
buyer.title: Organization

additionalIdentifiers.description: [Consult codelist] A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization. Consult the codelist for the preferred schemas to use.

contactPoint.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

identifier.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

scheme.description: [Consult codelist] The scheme that holds the unique identifiers used to identify the item being identified. Consult the codelists first to check the standard schemes recommended for this identifier.

id.description: The identifier for the Thing under the given scheme.

uri.description: URI to identify the Thing under the given scheme.

description.description: The text-based description of the id, if provided by the scheme. In the case of a goods classification, this maybe the description of the code. In the case of an organzational identifier, this may be the legal name as recorded by the used registry.

name.description: The used name of the organization. The ID property does provide an additional space for formal legal name, if common name is desired here.

address.__comment: No mergeStrategy - placed on higher level uses of identifier.

ocid.description: A unique identifier that identifies the unique Open Contracting Process. For more information see: http://ocds.open-contracting.org/standard/r/0__3__2/#defining-a-unique-contracting-process
ocid.title: Open Contracting ID

tag.description: [Consult codelist] A tag that identifies the nature of the release being made. Tags may be used to filter release, or, in future, for for advanced validation when certain kinds of releases should contain certain fields. See the codelist guidance for definitions of each tag.
tag.title: Release Tag

value.description: String specifying the type of initiation process used for this contract. Currently only tender is supported.
value.title: Initiation type

tender.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.
tender.title: Tender

value.description: Specify tendering method as per GPA definitions of Open, Selective, Limited (http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm)
The date or period on which an award is anticipated to be made.
The period during which enquiries may be made and answered.
The minimum estimated value of the procurement.
Specify the selection criteria, by lowest cost,
The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.
Any detailed or further information on the selection criteria.
An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.

Tender title

[Consult codelist] The current status of the tender e.g. active, cancelled.

value.description: Description of eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.

value.title: Items to be procured

value.description: The total estimated value of the procurement.
A Yes/No field as to whether enquiries were part of tender process.

documents.description: A list of documents related to the planning process, including public hearing notices.

value.description: This section contain information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon data model of the [Budget Data Package](https://github.com/openspending/budget-data-package/blob/master/specification.md), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.

project.description: The name of the project that through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.

dataSource.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, or to a machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.

budgetSource.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.
budgetSource.title: Budget Source

id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.

planning.title: Planning

awards.description: Information from the award phase of the contracting process. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.
awards.title: Awards

date.title: Release Date
date.description: The date this information is released, it may well be the same as the parent publishedDate, it must not be later than the publishedDate from the parent package. It is used to determine merge order.

id.description: A unique identifier that identifies this release. A releaseID must be unique within a release-package and must not contain the # character.
id.title: Release ID
